en: his oblation was one silver platter, the weight whereof was a hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal-offering;
hmr: a thilinhlân chu tangkaruo thlêng pakhat, a rikzie shekel za le sâwmthum, hmun inthienga shekel sâwmsari tluka rik tangkaruo châw- tawl pakhat, fâkmi thilinhlân dinga hriek chawkpawlsa, beiphit inditaka sip ve ve;

en: one golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense;
hmr: shekel sâwm tluka rik rimin- hnika sip rângkachak haihaw pakhat;

en: one young bullock, one ram, one he-lamb a year old, for a burnt-offering;
hmr: pumrawhmang thilinhlâna dingin bâwngchal tuoi pakhat, be- râmchal pakhat, berâmte a chal kum khat mi pakhat,

en: one male of the goats for a sin-offering;
hmr: suol thâwina dingin kêlchal pakhat;

en: and for the sacrifice of peace-offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, five he-lambs a year old: this was the oblation of Elishama the son of Ammihud.
hmr: chun, inremna inthâwi thilin- hlâna dingin bâwngchal pahni, berâmchal panga, kêlchal panga, berâmte a chal kum khat mi panga a nih. Hieng hi Ammihud naupa Eliasam thilinhlânhai chu an nih.

en: On the eighth day Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur, prince of the children of Manasseh:
hmr: Ni riet ni chun Manasse thlahai ṭhuoitu Pedahzur naupa Gamaliel chun ân hlân a;

en: his oblation was one silver platter, the weight whereof was a hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal-offering;
hmr: a thilinhlân chu tangkaruo thlêng pakhat, a rikzie shekel za le sâwmthum, hmun inthienga shekel sâwmsari tluka rik tangkaruo châw- tawl pakhat, fâkmi thilinhlân dinga hriek chawkpawlsa beiphit inditaka sip ve ve;

en: one golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense;
hmr: shekel sâwm tluka rik rimin- hnika sip rângkachak haihaw pakhat;

en: one young bullock, one ram, one he-lamb a year old, for a burnt-offering;
hmr: pumrawhmang thilinhlâna dingin bâwngchal tuoi pakhat, be- râmchal pakhat, beramtê a chal kum khat mi pakhat;

en: one male of the goats for a sin-offering;
hmr: suol inthâwina dingin kêlchal pakhat;

en: and for the sacrifice of peace-offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, five he-lambs a year old: this was the oblation of Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
hmr: chun, inremna inthâwi thilin- hlâna dingin bâwngchal pahni, be- râmchal panga, kêlchal panga, berâmte kum khat mi panga a nih. Hieng hi Pedahzur naupa Gamaliel thilinhlânhai chu an nih.

en: On the ninth day Abidan the son of Gideoni, prince of the children of Benjamin:
hmr: Ni kuo ni chun Benjamin thla Gideoni naupa Abidan chun ân hlân a;

en: his oblation was one silver platter, the weight whereof was a hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal-offering;
hmr: a thilinhlân chu tangkaruo thlêng pakhat, a rikzie shekel za le sâwmthum, hmun inthienga shekel sâwmsari tluka rik tangkaruo châw- tawl pakhat, fâkmi thilinhlân dinga hriek chawkpawlsa beiphit inditaka sip ve ve;

en: one golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense;
hmr: shekel sâwm tluka rik rimin- hnika sip rângkachak haihaw pakhat;

en: one young bullock, one ram, one he-lamb a year old, for a burnt-offering;
hmr: pumrawhmang thilinhlâna dingin bâwngchal tuoi pakhat, be- râmchal pakhat, berâmte a chal kum khat mi pakhat;

en: one male of the goats for a sin-offering;
hmr: suol thâwina dingin kêlchal pakhat;

en: and for the sacrifice of peace-offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, five he-lambs a year old: this was the oblation of Abidan the son of Gideoni.
hmr: chun, inremna inthâwi thilin- hlâna dingin bâwngchal pahni, be- râmchal panga, kêlchal panga, berâmte a chal kum khat mi panga a nih. Hieng hi Gideoni naupa Abidan thilinhlânhai chu an nih.

en: On the tenth day Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai, prince of the children of Dan:
hmr: Chun, ni sawm ni chun Dan thlahai ṭhuoitu Ammisaddai naupa Ahiezer chun ân hlân a;

en: his oblation was one silver platter, the weight whereof was a hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal-offering;
hmr: a thilinhlân chu tangkaruo thlêng pakhat, a rikzie shekel za le sâwmthum, hmun inthienga shekel sâwmsari tluka rik tangkaruo châw- tawl pakhat, fâkmi thilinhlâna dinga hriek chawkpawlsa beiphit inditaka sip ve ve;

en: one golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense;
hmr: shekel sâwm tluka rik rimin- hnika sip rângkachak haihaw pakhat;

en: one young bullock, one ram, one he-lamb a year old, for a burnt-offering;
hmr: pumrawhmang thilinhlâna dingin bâwngchal tuoi pakhat, be- râmchal pakhat, berâmte a chal kum khat mi pakhat,

en: one male of the goats for a sin-offering;
hmr: suol thâwina dingin kêlchal pakhat;

en: and for the sacrifice of peace-offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, five he-lambs a year old: this was the oblation of Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
hmr: chun, inremna inthâwi thilin- hlâna dingin bâwngchal pahni, berâmchal panga, kêlchal panga, berâmte a chal kum khat mi panga a nih. Hieng hi Ammisaddai naupa Ahiezer thilinhlânhai chu a nih.

en: On the eleventh day Pagiel the son of Ochran, prince of the children of Asher:
hmr: Ni sâwmpakhat ni chun, Aser thlahai ṭhuoitu Okran naupa Pagiel chun ân hlân a;

en: his oblation was one silver platter, the weight whereof was a hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal-offering;
hmr: a thilinhlân chu tangkaruo thlêng pakhat, a rikzie chu shekel za le sâwmthum, hmun inthienga she- kel sâwmsari tluka rik tangkaruo châwtawl pakhat, fâkmi thilinhlâna dinga hriek chawkpawlsa beiphit inditaka sip ve ve;

en: one golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense;
hmr: shekel sâwm tluka rik rimin- hnika sip rângkachak haihaw pakhat;

en: one young bullock, one ram, one he-lamb a year old, for a burnt-offering;
hmr: pumrawhmang thilinhlâna dingin bâwngchal tuoi pakhat, be- râmchal pakhat, berâmte a chal kum khat mi pakhat;

en: one male of the goats for a sin-offering;
hmr: suol thâwina dingin kêlchal pakhat;

en: and for the sacrifice of peace-offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, five he-lambs a year old: this was the oblation of Pagiel the son of Ochran.
hmr: chun, inremna inthâwi thilin- hlâna dingin bâwngchal pahni, berâmchal panga, kêlchal panga, berâmte a chal kum khat mi panga a nih. Hieng hi Okran naupa Pagiel thilinhlânhai chu an nih.

en: On the twelfth day Ahira the son of Enan, prince of the children of Naphtali:
hmr: Ni sâwmpahni ni chun, Naph- tali thlahai ṭhuoitu Enan naupa Ahira chun ân hlân a;

en: his oblation was one silver platter, the weight whereof was a hundred and thirty shekels, one silver bowl of seventy shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine flour mingled with oil for a meal-offering;
hmr: a thilinhlânhai chu tangkaruo thlêng pakhat, a rikzie shekel zâ le sâwmthum, hmun inthienga shekel sâwmsari tluka rik tangkaruo châw- tawl pakhat, fâkmi thilinhlâna dinga hriek chawkpawlsa beiphit inditaka sip ve ve;

en: one golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense;
hmr: shekel sâwm tluka rik rimin- hnika sip rângkachak haihaw pakhat;

en: one young bullock, one ram, one he-lamb a year old, for a burnt-offering;
hmr: pumrawhmang thilinhlâna dingin bâwngchal tuoi pakhat, be- râmchal pakhat, berâmte a chal kum khat mi pakhat;

en: one male of the goats for a sin-offering;
hmr: suol thâwina dingin kelchal pakhat;

en: and for the sacrifice of peace-offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, five he-lambs a year old: this was the oblation of Ahira the son of Enan.
hmr: inremna inthâwi thilinhlâna dingin bâwngchal pahni, berâmchal panga, kêlchal panga, berâmte a chal kum khat mi panga a nih. Hieng hi Enan naupa Ahira thilinhlânhai chu an nih.

en: This was the dedication of the altar, in the day when it was anointed, by the princes of Israel: twelve silver platters, twelve silver bowls, twelve golden spoons;
hmr: Chun, mâichâm hriek nâl nia Israel ṭhuoituhai thilinhlânhai chu tangkaruo thlêng sâwmpahni, tang- karuo châwtawl sâwmpahni, rângka- chak haihaw sâwmpahni;

en: each silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and each bowl seventy; all the silver of the vessels two thousand and four hundred shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary;
hmr: tangkaruo thlêng chu shekel zâ le sâwmthum tluka rik seng an nih; châwtawl chu sâwmsari seng a rik a nih; tangkaruo bûrlebêlhai po po chu hmun inthienga shekel sâng hni le za li tluka rik a nih.

en: the twelve golden spoons, full of incense, weighing ten shekels apiece, after the shekel of the sanctuary; all the gold of the spoons a hundred and twenty shekels;
hmr: Riminhnika sip rângkachak haihaw sâwmpahni chu hmun in- thienga shekel sâwm tluka rik seng an nih; rângkachak haihawhai po po chu shekel za le sâwmhni tluka rik a nih;

en: all the oxen for the burnt-offering twelve bullocks, the rams twelve, the he-lambs a year old twelve, and their meal-offering; and the males of the goats for a sin-offering twelve;
hmr: pumrawhmang thilinhlân ding- a bâwngchal po po chu sâwmpahni an nih; berâmchal sâwmpahni, berâmte a chal kum khat mi sâwmpahni, an fâkmi thilinhlânhai leh; chun, suol thâwina dingin kêlchal sâwmpahni;

en: and all the oxen for the sacrifice of peace-offerings twenty and four bullocks, the rams sixty, the he-goats sixty, the he-lambs a year old sixty. This was the dedication of the altar, after that it was anointed.
hmr: inremna inthâwi thilinhlâna dingin bâwngchal sâwmhni pali, berâmchal sâwmruk, kêlchal sâwm- ruk le berâmte a chal kum khat mi chu sâwmruk a nih. Hi hi hriek nâl hnunga mâichâm inhlânna thilin- hlânhai a nih.

en: And when Moses went into the tent of meeting to speak with him, then he heard the Voice speaking unto him from above the mercy-seat that was upon the ark of the testimony, from between the two cherubim: and he spake unto him.
hmr: Chuongchun, intuokna puon ina ama be dinga Mosie a lût chun thuthlung bâwm chunga zângaina ṭhungpha chungtienga cherub pahni- hai inkâra inthawk chun ama hung bein rawl a hriet a; rawl chun a biek tah a.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie a biek a,

en: Speak unto Aaron, and say unto him, When thou lightest the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light in front of the candlestick.
hmr: “Aron hril la, a kuomah, ‘Khâwnvarhai chu i sitin khâwnvar pasari chun sathâu khâwnvar siena hmatieng a ên ding a nih,’ ti rawh,” tiin.

en: And Aaron did so; he lighted the lamps thereof so as to give light in front of the candlestick, as Jehovah commanded Moses.
hmr: Aron chun chuong ang chun a thawh a; LALPAIN Mosie thu a pêk ang chun a thawh a; LALPAIN Mosie thu a pêk ang chun khâwnvar siena hmatienga chun khâwnvarhai chu a sit a.

en: And this was the work of the candlestick, beaten work of gold; unto the base thereof, and unto the flowers thereof, it was beaten work: according unto the pattern which Jehovah had showed Moses, so he made the candlestick.
hmr: Hi khâwnvar siena siem dân chu rangkachak, a suta sut a nih, a ngul bul le a pâr chena sut a nih; LALPAIN Mosie ân entir ang chiein khâwnvar siena chu a siem a.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie a biek a,

en: Take the Levites from among the children of Israel, and cleanse them.
hmr: “Levi mihai chu Israel thlahai laia inthawkin suktum la, sukthieng rawh.

en: And thus shalt thou do unto them, to cleanse them: sprinkle the water of expiation upon them, and let them cause a razor to pass over all their flesh, and let them wash their clothes, and cleanse themselves.
hmr: Anni chu sukthieng dingin hieng ang hin i thaw ding a nih; an chungah intlêng faina tui infar la, an taksa po po chu invâwtir la; an puonhai insâwptir la, insukthiengtir rawh.

en: Then let them take a young bullock, and its meal-offering, fine flour mingled with oil; and another young bullock shalt thou take for a sin-offering.
hmr: Bâwngchal tuoi pakhat, a fâkmi thilinhlân, hrieka pawl beiphit inditak leh inlâktir la; suol thâwina dingin bâwngchal tuoi dang pakhat i kei bawk ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt present the Levites before the tent of meeting: and thou shalt assemble the whole congregation of the children of Israel:
hmr: Levi mihai chu intuokna puon in bula chun ṭhuoi la, Israel thlahai mipui po po chu inpungkhâwmtir vawng rawh;

en: and thou shalt present the Levites before Jehovah. And the children of Israel shall lay their hands upon the Levites:
hmr: chun, Levi mihai chu LALPA kuomah inhlân i ta; Israel thlahai chun Levi mihai chunga chun an kuthai innghat an ta,

en: and Aaron shall offer the Levites before Jehovah for a wave-offering, on the behalf of the children of Israel, that it may be theirs to do the service of Jehovah.
hmr: chuongchun, Aron chun Levi mihai chu LALPA rawng an bâwl theina dingin Israel thlahai hmingin a thêna thên thilinhlânah LALPA kuomah inhlân a tih.

en: And the Levites shall lay their hands upon the heads of the bullocks: and offer thou the one for a sin-offering, and the other for a burnt-offering, unto Jehovah, to make atonement for the Levites.
hmr: Levi mihai chun bâwngchal luahai chun an kut innghat an ta; chun, Levi mihai ta dinga inremna siemna dingin, pakhat chu suol thâwina dingin, pakhat chu pumraw- hmang thilinhlâna dingin LALPA kuomah în hlân ding a nih.

en: And thou shalt set the Levites before Aaron, and before his sons, and offer them for a wave-offering unto Jehovah.
hmr: Levi mihai chu Aron le a naupasalhai hmaa chun inumtir i ta; LALPA ta dinga a thêna thên thilinhlânah în hlân ding a nih.

en: Thus shalt thou separate the Levites from among the children of Israel; and the Levites shall be mine.
hmr: Chuong ang chun Israel thlahai laia inthawkin Levi mihai chu suktum i ta, chuongchun, Levi mihai chu ka ta nîng an tih.

en: And after that shall the Levites go in to do the service of the tent of meeting: and thou shalt cleanse them, and offer them for a wave-offering.
hmr: Chu zoa chun Levi mihai chu intuokna puon ina rawngbâwl dingin lût an ta; nangin anni chu sukthieng i ta, a thêna thên thilinhlânah în hlân ding a nih.

en: For they are wholly given unto me from among the children of Israel; instead of all that openeth the womb, even the first-born of all the children of Israel, have I taken them unto me.
hmr: Israel thlahai laia ka chanpuol dinga ruot an ni sih a; sul hung kêu ta po po Israel thlahai nau lutir po po aiah ka chanpuola ka nei tah a nih.

en: For all the first-born among the children of Israel are mine, both man and beast: on the day that I smote all the first-born in the land of Egypt I sanctified them for myself.
hmr: Israel thlahai laia nau lutir po po chu ka ta an ni hrim a, mi- hriem ni leh, ran ni leh; Aigupta rama nau lutir po po ka sukhlum lai khan ka chanpuolah ka ruot tah a nih.

en: And I have taken the Levites instead of all the first-born among the children of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel thlahai lai nau lutir po po aiah Levi mihai hi ka nei tah a nih.

en: And I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and to his sons from among the children of Israel, to do the service of the children of Israel in the tent of meeting, and to make atonement for the children of Israel; that there be no plague among the children of Israel, when the children of Israel come nigh unto the sanctuary.
hmr: Chuongchun, Israel thlahai aia intuokna puon ina rawngbâwl ding le, Israel thlahaiin hmun inthieng an hung hnai khawma Israel thlahai laia hri ân lêng nawna dinga inremna siem dingin Israel thlahai laia inthawkin Levi mihai hi Aron le a naupasalhai ka pêk a nih,” tiin.

en: Thus did Moses, and Aaron, and all the congregation of the children of Israel, unto the Levites: according unto all that Jehovah commanded Moses touching the Levites, so did the children of Israel unto them.
hmr: Chuong ang chun Mosie hai, Aron hai, Israel thlahai pung- khâwmhai po po chun Levi mihai chunga chun an thawh a; Levi mihai chungchâng thua LALPAIN Mosie thu a pêk ang po po chun an chungah Israel thlahai chun an thawh a.

en: And the Levites purified themselves from sin, and they washed their clothes: and Aaron offered them for a wave-offering before Jehovah; and Aaron made atonement for them to cleanse them.
hmr: Chuongchun, Levi mihai chu suola inthawk chun an insukthieng a, an puonhai an sâwp a; chun, Aron chun LALPA hmaa a thêna thên thilinhlân dingin ân hlân a; chun, anni chu sukthiengna ding Aronin inremna a siempêk a.

en: And after that went the Levites in to do their service in the tent of meeting before Aaron, and before his sons: as Jehovah had commanded Moses concerning the Levites, so did they unto them.
hmr: Chun, chu zoa chun Levi mihai chu Aron le a naupasalhai hnuoia an rawngbâwl sin thaw ding chun intuokna puon in sûnga chun an lût a; Levi mihai chungchâng thua LALPA- IN Mosie thu a pêk angin an chunga chun an thaw tah a.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie a biek a,

en: This is that which belongeth unto the Levites: from twenty and five years old and upward they shall go in to wait upon the service in the work of the tent of meeting:
hmr: “Levi mihai chanpuol chu hieng hi a nih, kum sâwmhni panga chen chungtieng chun intuokna puon ina rawngbâwlna sin thâwng an ta;

en: and from the age of fifty years they shall cease waiting upon the work, and shall serve no more,
hmr: kum sâwmnga mihai chun chu rawngbâwl sin chu châwlsan an ta, rawngbâwl ta naw ni hai.

en: but shall minister with their brethren in the tent of meeting, to keep the charge, and shall do no service. Thus shalt thou do unto the Levites touching their charges.
hmr: Amiruokchu, intuokna puon in enkawl thua chun an unauhai ṭhang- pui pei an ta, rawng ruok chu bâwl ta naw ni hai. Hieng ang hin Levi mihai chu an sin ding i rêlpêk ding a nih,” tiin.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the first month of the second year after they were come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
hmr: LALPA chun Aigupta rama in- thawka an suok chen kum hnina thla khatnaah Sinai thlalêra chun Mosie a biek a,

en: Moreover let the children of Israel keep the passover in its appointed season.
hmr: “Israel thlahai chun Fekân ruoiṭhe chu a hunbi peiah nei raw se.

en: In the fourteenth day of this month, at even, ye shall keep it in its appointed season: according to all the statutes of it, and according to all the ordinances thereof, shall ye keep it.
hmr: A hunbiah, hi thla ni sâwmpali zântieng in nei ding a nih; chu- taka thaw dinga ruot ang po po le, a dân ang po po chu in nei ding a nih,” tiin.

en: And Moses spake unto the children of Israel, that they should keep the passover.
hmr: Chuongchun, Mosie chun Israel thlahai chu Fekân ruoiṭhe chu nei dingin a hril a.

en: And they kept the passover in the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month, at even, in the wilderness of Sinai: according to all that Jehovah commanded Moses, so did the children of Israel.
hmr: Chuongchun, Sinai thlalêra chun thla khatna ni sâwmpali ni zântieng fekân ruoiṭhe chu an nei tah a; LALPAIN Mosie thu a pêk ang po po chun Israel thlahai chun an thawh a.

en: And there were certain men, who were unclean by reason of the dead body of a man, so that they could not keep the passover on that day: and they came before Moses and before Aaron on that day:
hmr: Chun, tuhai amanih mithi ruong leia thieng naw an lo um a. Chu ni chun fekân ruoiṭhenaa chun an ṭhang ve thei nawh a. Chuongchun, chu ni chun Mosie le Aron hmaa chun an feh a.

en: and those men said unto him, We are unclean by reason of the dead body of a man: wherefore are we kept back, that we may not offer the oblation of Jehovah in its appointed season among the children of Israel?
hmr: Chuonghai chun a kuomah, “Mithi ruong leiin kan inthieng naw a ni tah a, iengleiin am Israel thlahai laia a hunbia LALPA kuoma thilin- hlân kan inhlân ding in mi khap a na?” an tih a.

en: And Moses said unto them, Stay ye, that I may hear what Jehovah will command concerning you.
hmr: Mosie chun an kuomah, “Lo to ta u, in chungchâng thuah LALPAIN ieng angin am thu a pêk ding hang hre phawt ei tih,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah spake unto Moses, saying,
hmr: LALPA chun Mosie a biek a,

en: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, If any man of you or of your generations shall be unclean by reason of a dead body, or be on a journey afar off, yet he shall keep the passover unto Jehovah.
hmr: “Israel thlahai kuomah, ‘Nang- ni laia mi khawm, in thlahai laia mi khawm, mithi ruong leia thieng naw amanih, lo thanghmang amanih an um hlau chun LALPA ta dinga Fekân ruoiṭhe chu an nei ve hrim hrim ding a nih.

en: In the second month on the fourteenth day at even they shall keep it; they shall eat it with unleavened bread and bitter herbs:
hmr: Thla hnina ni sâwmpali ni zântieng an nei ding a nih. Chawl ṭhanglo bei hlohna kha leh an fâk ding a nih.

en: they shall leave none of it unto the morning, nor break a bone thereof: according to all the statute of the passover they shall keep it.
hmr: A zînga dingin a iengkhawm an sie ding a ni nawh a, a ru khawm an sukthliek ding a ni bawk nawh; Fekân ruoiṭhe thaw dinga ruot ang po po chu an thaw ding a nih.

en: But the man that is clean, and is not on a journey, and forbeareth to keep the passover, that soul shall be cut off from his people; because he offered not the oblation of Jehovah in its appointed season, that man shall bear his sin.
hmr: Amiruokchu, thieng si, thang- hmangna khawm nei chuong loa Fekân ruoiṭhea ṭhang lo chu a chipuihai laia inthawk sât thlâk nîng a ta; a hunbia LALPA kuoma thilin- hlân chu ân hlân naw leiin ama chun a suol maw chu phur a tih.

en: And if a stranger shall sojourn among you, and will keep the passover unto Jehovah; according to the statute of the passover, and according to the ordinance thereof, so shall he do: ye shall have one statute, both for the sojourner, and for him that is born in the land.
hmr: Chun, hnam dang mi in kuoma umin, LALPA ta ding Fekân ruoiṭhea ṭhang ve a nuom chun Fekân ruoi- ṭhea thaw dinga ruot le a dân angin an thaw ding a nih; hi rama mi hrim hrim le hnam dang mihai ta dingin dân angkhat in nei ding a nih,’ tiin hril rawh,” a ta.

en: And on the day that the tabernacle was reared up the cloud covered the tabernacle, even the tent of the testimony: and at even it was upon the tabernacle as it were the appearance of fire, until morning.
hmr: Chuongchun, biekbûk indin ni chun biekbûk, inhriettirna puon in chu sûmin a tuom mup a, chun, zântieng chun biekbûk chunga chun meichawk ang el hi a zîng zîngkâr chenin a um a.

en: So it was alway: the cloud covered it, and the appearance of fire by night.
hmr: Chuong ang chun a um zing a; sûm chun a tuom zing a, zâna chun mei angin ân lâng a.

en: And whenever the cloud was taken up from over the Tent, then after that the children of Israel journeyed: and in the place where the cloud abode, there the children of Israel encamped.
hmr: Sûmin puon in chu ân kiengsan po leh, Israel thlahai chun fe zai an rêl hlak a; chun, sûm a ngirna hmuna phawt chun Israel thlahai chun umhmun an khuor hlak.

en: At the commandment of Jehovah the children of Israel journeyed, and at the commandment of Jehovah they encamped: as long as the cloud abode upon the tabernacle they remained encamped.
hmr: LALPA thupêkin Israel thlahai chu an fe pei a, LALPA thupêk bawk- in umhmun an khuor hlak a; biekbûk chunga sûm chu a um sûng po umhmun an khuor zing a.

en: And when the cloud tarried upon the tabernacle many days, then the children of Israel kept the charge of Jehovah, and journeyed not.
hmr: Biekbûk chunga sûm chu sâwttak a um chun Israel thlahai chun LALPA thu chu an zâwm a, an fe ngai nawh.

en: And sometimes the cloud was a few days upon the tabernacle; then according to the commandment of Jehovah they remained encamped, and according to the commandment of Jehovah they journeyed.
hmr: A châng chun sûm chu biekbûk chunga chun sâwt nawtê chau a um hlak a; chuongchun, LALPA thupêk angin an fe hlak.

en: And sometimes the cloud was from evening until morning; and when the cloud was taken up in the morning, they journeyed: or if it continued by day and by night, when the cloud was taken up, they journeyed.
hmr: A châng chun sûm chu zân- tienga inthawkin zîngtieng chen a um a; chun, zîngkâra sûm chu ân vawr sâng chun an fe hlak a; ni khat chau amanih, zân khat chau amanih uma sûm chu ân vawr sâng chun an fe el hlak a.

en: Whether it were two days, or a month, or a year, that the cloud tarried upon the tabernacle, abiding thereon, the children of Israel remained encamped, and journeyed not; but when it was taken up, they journeyed.
hmr: Biekbûk chungah sûm chu ni hni amanih, thla khat amanih, kum khat amani khawm a um chun, chutaka a um zing chun Israel thla- hai chun umhmun an khuor zing a, an fe ngai nawh a; ân vawr sâng ruok chun an fe hlak.

en: At the commandment of Jehovah they encamped, and at the commandment of Jehovah they journeyed: they kept the charge of Jehovah, at the commandment of Jehovah by Moses.
hmr: LALPA thupêkin umhmun an khuor hlak a, LALPA thupêkin an fe hlak; Mosie hmanga LALPA thupêkin LALPA thu chu an zâwm a.
